title: L’« e-lettre rouge » de La Poste, le courrier en mode hybride

last_post.content: Remplaçante officielle du timbre rouge, la « e-lettre rouge » est un objet postal d’un genre nouveau, à mi-chemin entre le pli traditionnel et le courrier électronique. 👉 L’« e-lettre rouge » de La Poste, le courrier en mode hybride https://www.lemonde.fr/economie/article/2023/01/26/l-e-lettre-rouge-de-la-poste-le-courrier-en-mode-hybride_6159404_3234.html?utm_medium=Social&utm_source=Mastodon

title: Don’t snark on people who are learning

last_post.content:
I saw a post on mastodon snarking at "the current state of web development" and it was a screenshot of a forum where someone was asking why nested s got progressively bigger, with a code sample that looked like this:

export default function Home() {
return (
<>
<h1>
test
<h1>test2
<h1>test3</h1>
</h1>
</h1>
</>
)
}

There's two things going on here: nesting headings is not allowed, as per the sp
https://andy-bell.co.uk/dont-snark-on-people-who-are-learning/

title: Pairing the Garmin GLO Series with Android | Garmin Customer Support

last_post.content:
I finally managed to get my external GPS/GLONASS receiver (Garmin GLO2) talk to my Android smartphone. If you're looking to do it too, you need to follow this guide:
https://support.garmin.com/en-US/?faq=Mi8TKRtjWe6Cp4hwKvwFH7 (change en-US to fr-FR for french instructions). "GPS Connector" app worked fine for me.

Now who's got up to 3m precision and 24 more satellites available for walking/bike/car directions and sailboat navigation? \o/

#Garmin #GarminGlo2 (not fond of hashtagging brands, but this could help someone else...)

title: The Ostrich for the Defence (1912) by William Henry Hile

last_post.content:
Whenever I do research on one of the many weird or terrible early utopian novels I "enjoy” reading, I always set up some eBay saved searches in case any related ephemera turn up.

Anyway I'm now the proud owner of 6 postcards from a failed 1912-era Pennsylvania ostrich farm/securities fraud.

The original 2022 article on the venture and its accompanying novel: https://lizadaly.com/pages/utopian-novels/ostrich-for-the-defence.html

title: Growth rates of modern science: a latent piecewise growth curve approach to model publication numbers from established and new literature databases - Humanities and Social Sciences Communications

last_post.content:
@Neurograce There's also the fact that science as an enterprise has been growing, at a rate of 5% annually since 1800 or so–measuring by the number of publications. So a professor in the 90's had far less publications and labs to look up than we do now. Today, we need distillers more than ever, producing good reviews that summarize across the vast publication record.

Figure from https://www.nature.com/articles/s41599-021-00903-w

Our mission is to build the most mindful calendar. Although calendars have recently experienced a renaissance, we feel the default continues to prioritise teams/professionals. Not people. title: Stability of Bogoliubov Fermi Surfaces within BCS Theory

last_post.content: Today's #arXivsummary: https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.10524 by Bhattacharya & Timm. Authors show that, within BCS theory, that the time-reversal-symmetry-breaking states are stabilized over broad parameter ranges at weak coupling. A fast method that involves solving the inverse BCS gap equation (which does not require iteration) introduced. #CondMat #SuprCon #arXiv_2301_10524
Here's the link to my newsletter: https://heidiseibold.ck.page/

title: Macroeconomic Changes Have Made It Impossible for Me to Want to Pay You

last_post.content: I’ve been thinking about how to phrase this for days and of course McSweeney’s nails it as a side joke in a too-real-to-be-satire article. https://www.mcsweeneys.net/articles/macroeconomic-changes-have-made-it-impossible-for-me-to-want-to-pay-you

The narrative around #Brexit has been an interesting and confusing one.

And the fact that the "public" is not well informed and that polls need a careful read is quite obvious.

Let me give you an example. This is based on analysis from a large scale poll carried out by Survation in 2018.

What did the public want? Or what tradeoffs were #Leave #Remain voters willing to make...

This is drawn from my paper: "Who is NOT voting for #Brexit anymore?"

Paper https://tinyurl.com/45bz4tz8

title: What the hell is REST, Anyway?

last_post.content:
if anyone's wondering, when i say "representational state transfer" i mean the "how do i invisibly thread state between rpc calls" thing and when i say "hypermedia apis" i mean "how can a method return a service to a client" stuff—not the random slapfighting about verbs and urls that passes for engineering

and if you want examples of the former, i did write a tumblr post a while back

https://programmingisterrible.com/post/181841346708/what-the-hell-is-rest-anyway

Three years ago I published MAdB, a Location Intelligence web app that tries to raise public awareness of the short-term effects of road traffic #noise on people's #health. You can wander around #Madrid and check the noise levels impacting any built unit, the attributable health risks and compare night/day values or the most/least affected facade.

Limitations: Spanish only & desktop only

https://madb.netlify.app

#Genuary26 #Genuary

Day 26: My kid could have done that

For this prompt I implemented the sinuous meander patterns of Chappell. They resemble the bug-eyed, multi-legged monsters that my kid used to draw when he was little, all spirals and curves with countless appendages.

https://doi.org/10.1080/17513472.2015.1092859

Coded in #Rstats using #ggplot2. The code is in my #genuary2023 repo:

https://github.com/paezha/genuary2023/tree/master/2022-01-26_My-kid-could-have-done-that

title: Women scientists at famed oceanography institute have half the lab space of men

last_post.content:
Women scientists at famed oceanography institute have half the lab space of men. The gap can’t be “explained away” by funding or seniority, says Scripps Institution of Oceanography report https://www.science.org/content/article/women-scientists-famed-oceanography-institute-have-half-lab-space-men

" The 16 labs defined as “very large” all belong to men. Women also have less office space. And of 32 coveted storage containers in service yards on site—as opposed to at less convenient remote locations—31 are assigned to men."

via https://twitter.com/iruka_okeke/status/1618525582664536066

title: Unicode operators for semantically correct programming

last_post.content:
🆕 blog! “Unicode operators for semantically correct programming”

Why do most programming languages use the / character when we have a perfectly good ÷ symbol? Similarly, why use != instead of ≠? Or => rather than →? The obvious answer is that the humble keyboard usually only has around 100 keys - and most humans have a hard time remembering where tho…

👀 Read more: https://shkspr.mobi/blog/2023/01/unicode-operators-for-semantically-correct-programming/
⸻

Here are the lighthouses of Europe.

The map is even better than it might seem at first glance: the colors are the real colors, the patterns are the real patterns, and the size of the dots is the distance at which each light is visible.

Made with @openstreetmap, Leaflet, and the Overpass API.

https://geodienst.github.io/lighthousemap/

From the Geodienst researchers of Groningen University (NL), via Ethan Mollick

title: Mike Hopkins’ Impromptu Space Gardening - The Unconventional Gardener

last_post.content:
In 2013, NASA astronaut Mike Hopkins did a little bit of DIY space gardening on the International Space Station.

He sprouted sunflower and pumpkin seeds in Ziplock bags and modified tubes.

Mike tweeted a handful of images of his gardening efforts, and I've collected them in a blog post (removing as much of the Twitter taint as possible 😂 ).

#SpacePlants #SpaceGardening

https://theunconventionalgardener.com/blog/mike-hopkins-impromptu-space-gardening/

title: Fourth-Quarter GDP Report to Show Pace of U.S. Growth Late Last Year

last_post.content: New on @wsj : "Fourth-Quarter GDP Report to Show Pace of U.S. Growth Late Last Year" https://www.wsj.com/articles/us-gdp-economic-growth-fourth-quarter-2022-11674683034

I am exploring what you can get out of the new NZ Ministry of Health dashboard, https://minhealthnz2.shinyapps.io/covid19/ , and there is pretty clear evidence of a sustained drop in the case fatality rate among 80 years and up in September. No particularly dramatic variant changes, and from the suddenness of the drop it does look more like the kind of response I would expect from better treatments rather than booster vaccines.

title: New Publication: Creating Specialised Corpora from Digitized Historical Newspaper Archives | Joshua Wilson Black

last_post.content:
I've done a lot of newspaper research, but up to now via traditional methods (i.e. going through page by page) combined with word searches in digitised collections. This excellent article from @JoshBlack gives some great insight into more powerful options for using historical newspapers.

(It also makes clear how much work is involved...)

title: GitHub - styfenschaer/rocket-fft: Rocket-FFT makes Numba aware of  numpy.fft and scipy.fft. Rocket-FFT takes its name from the PocketFFT Fast Fourier Transformation library that powers it, and Numba's goal of making your scientific Python code blazingly fast - like a rocket. 🚀

Look at what Safari Technology Preview 161 includes!

• RegExp lookbehind
• OffscreenCanvas (2D)
• WASM SIMD
• unprefixed Fullscreen API
• CSS Custom Properties (@property)
• CSS Typed OM
• more pseudo-classes work inside :has()
• :user-invalid & :user-valid
• Web Animations improvements

And a *lot* more. Click through to read the whole list!

title: Closing Central Madrid To Cars Resulted In 9.5% Boost To Retail Spending, Finds Bank Analysis

last_post.content:
This is important — closing Central #Madrid to cars over holidays resulted in a 9.5% boost in retail spending on its main shopping street: STUDY.

There was also a 71% drop in air pollution.

Via @carltonreid in Forbes. #citymakingmath #citiesforpeople #cities #cars #streets #urbanism #Spain

https://www.forbes.com/sites/carltonreid/2019/03/08/closing-central-madrid-to-cars-resulted-in-9-5-boost-to-retail-spending-finds-bank-analysis/

title: Nevada Governor Turns to Lobbyist Tied to COVID Lab Scandal for Help With Budget

last_post.content:
“During his contentious campaign to become Nevada governor, Joe Lombardo accused the Democratic incumbent of catering to the family of a donor and their lobbyist who helped an error-prone COVID-19 testing lab get licensed in the state.
“Shortly after he won the race, Lombardo, a Republican, quietly turned to that same lobbyist for help building the state budget, giving him access to confidential documents and putting him in a position that allowed him to advocate for state funding sought by his clients.”
https://www.propublica.org/article/nevada-lombardo-northshore-covid-sisolak-willden

This is a really interesting study. When Black newborns are cared for by Black physicians, their "clinical penalty" that is the difference in mortality from white newborns is halved.

What's fascinating, if you dive in, is that this is despite the fact that Black physicians tend to have higher caseloads, and also tend to serve more underresourced patients.

Things that make you go hmmmmm...

https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.1913405117

HT: @TheRaDR

title: Family mass murders account for 41% of deaths

title: New Childcare Data Shows Prices Are Untenable for Families | U.S. Department of Labor Blog

last_post.content: This new #opendata from @lclandivar at US Dept of Labor is amazing: "The National Database of Childcare Prices is a new source of data showing how prices vary by childcare provider type and children’s age in 2,360 counties across 47 states." http://blog.dol.gov/2023/01/24/new-childcare-data-shows-prices-are-untenable-for-families. And their report on the data: https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/WB/NDCP/WB_IssueBrief-NDCP-final.pdf. The #childcare is too damn high.

title: Working from home saves employees 2 hours a week in commute time, and they’re spending it in ways CEOs don’t expect

last_post.content:
Study of 27 countries finds the average daily time savings for remote work is 72 min per person. Workers allocate 40% of the saved time to their jobs, 11% to caregiving, and 34% to leisure.
https://fortune.com/2023/01/24/worker-productivity-spend-commute-time-working/

title: How To Practice “Productive Procrastination” - Clive Thompson - Medium

last_post.content:
"How to Practice 'Productive Procrastination'"

An essay in which I meditate on the idea of inventor Saul Griffith ...

... which is:

Pick some side "learning projects" -- little things you want to do that require you to pick up a new skill

Then when you can't face work ...

... do one of your side projects for a bit

It's -- worked for me? My essay on it: https://clivethompson.medium.com/how-to-practice-productive-procrastination-e2522247bd07

(If you're not a Medium subscriber, here's a "friend" link: https://clivethompson.medium.com/how-to-practice-productive-procrastination-e2522247bd07?sk=c43f6ca1b4b098052e77175cb834a758)

One of those services is:
acm - AWS Certificate Manager (ACM)

Unfortunately, this command shows no quotas for the ACM service.

$ aws service-quotas \
list-service-quotas \
--service-code acm
{
"Quotas": []
}

even though we know the ACM service has quotas, and they even have quota codes:

https://us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/servicequotas/home/services/acm/quotas/L-FB94F0B0

The ARN for the above has a service code of "acm" and a quota code of "L-FB94F0B0", so we know we're looking in the right place in the cli.

4/

title: The Journal of Slavery and Data Preservation

last_post.content:
I have been using the Freedmen's Teacher Project data set a lot and it's been invaluable. It contains information on 11,000+ freedmen's teachers including who sponsored them and basic demographic info. Today I'm using it to research educators at Talladega College during reconstruction. Follow along if you want to see what I've learned today.

You can download the data as an excel spreadsheet at this link: https://jsdp.enslaved.org/fullDataArticle/volume3-issue1-freedmens-teacher-project/

#data #digitalhumanities #spreadsheet #excel
